headline: Heard on the Street: Tariffs Hit GM’s Stock Harder than Ford’s. Does That Make Sense?
summary: Investors think Donald Trump’s 25% tariff on imported autos is a bigger roadblock for General Motors than Ford.  The tariff announcement knocked about 11% off of GM’s shares, while Ford’s dropped by about 5%, even though the former’s business has been doing much better of late.  Ford is, on the surface, a much more American carmaker.

headline: Auto tariffs are 'close to the worst outcome' for automakers
summary: The US auto industry faces uncertainty with President Trump's upcoming 25% tariffs set to begin next week. TD Cowen analyst Itay Michaeli joins Catalysts host Madison Mills and Basenese Group founder Lou Basenese to discuss the potential impact. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Importing European Cars Into The U.S.? Prepare For A Price Shock
summary: As of 3 April, US imports of cars and, no later than 3 May, foreign car parts are subject to a 25% tariff to protect the American automobile industry and national security. Click to read.

headline: Stocks to Watch: Lululemon, General Motors, Deutsche Bank
summary: ↘️ Lululemon Athletica (LULU): The activewear company expects sales growth to slow this year, as consumers hold back on spending amid macroeconomic uncertainty. Shares fell more than 10%. ↘️ Hyundai Motor (KR:005380), Toyota Motor (JP:7203), Mercedes-Benz (XE:MBG), Porsche (XE:P911): Shares of global automakers fell further, following President Trump's announcement of auto tariffs this week.

headline: Stock Market News For Mar 28, 2025
summary: U.S. stocks ended lower for the second straight session on Thursday, weighed down by President Donald Trump's fresh tariff announcement on foreign-made cars, while investors awaited the release of the personal consumption expenditure (PCE) reading on Friday.
